info.part2: (e.g., Odin Book, Messaging App ...) will need a few seconds to make their servers operational following an initial request. The APIs for these projects are hosted for free on the

odinBook.description: A social media application that implements the main features of social media platforms. Key features include adding friends, creating and customizing user profiles, as well as posting posts, photos, and comments.

messagingApp.description: A web messaging application that allows users to send and receive real-time messages using web sockets implemented through the Socket.IO library.

devLog.description: A personal blog platform designed to share my research and discoveries in web development. This project provides a space to document my learning journey, present tutorials, and explore new web technologies.

instagramClone.description: A full-stack Instagram clone that implements the main features of the social media platform. Key features include authentication, creating and deleting posts, as well as a real-time user search interface.

odinBlog.description: A functional blog allowing users to authenticate, read articles, and add comments. The frontend part of the blog is powered by a RESTful API created through Express.js and MongoDB.

shoppingCart.description: An online computer store created through React to reflect, in real-time, changes resulting from user interactions. The site allows users to browse, add, and remove items from their cart.

membersOnly.description: An exclusive clubhouse application created using Express.js and Passport.js for authentication.

battleship.description: A strategic multiplayer game built with Vanilla JavaScript and driven by tests implemented through Jest.

wheresWaldo.description: An interactive version of 'Where's Waldo?', a game consisting of finding multiple characters in an image.

cvApplication.description: A CV generator allowing users to dynamically create professional resumes.

memoryCard.description: A memory game including 12 cards and 12 characters created using React.

binarySearchTrees.description: An implementation of the binary search tree data structure written in JavaScript.

contact.title: Get In Touch
contact.description: Feel free to reach out if you have a question or want to work together. I'll be happy to respond!
